results.summary_short: “Grown Ups” is a sloppy entry into this year’s man-child-comedy sweepstakes.

results.summary_short: A bizarre portrayal of family life in Yorgos Lanthimos’s “Dogtooth.”

results.summary_short: Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz travel the globe and try to crack wise in “Knight and Day.”

results.summary_short: Woody, Buzz Lightyear and the cast from the first two “Toy Story” installments are joined by a new set of playthings.

results.headline: You Have Issues? So Does Everybody

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Let It Rain

results.summary_short: The low-level politicians and media types who inhabit Agnès Jaoui’s “Let It Rain” feel victimized in one way or another.

results.headline: From Tapestried Villa to Sylvan Glade, Aristocratic Women in Love

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of I Am Love

results.summary_short: In this soaringly beautiful Italian film nothing holds your gaze as forcefully as Tilda Swinton’s alabaster face.

results.summary_short: “Le Amiche” finally gets a theatrical run in the United States, at Film Forum.

results.summary_short: “Wah Do Dem” stars Sean Bones as a musician trying to shake off his depression in Jamaica.

results.headline: Asking Big Questions

results.summary_short: Roger Nygard’s documentary “The Nature of Existence” asks big questions, but not in a heavy-handed way.

results.summary_short: Michael Winterbottom’s “Killer Inside Me” is an adaptation of Jim Thompson’s nasty little crime novel.

results.summary_short: Josh Brolin brings “Jonah Hex,” the comic-book bounty hunter, to unforgiving life (and many deaths).

results.headline: Marching in the War on Gay Marriage

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 8: The Mormon Proposition

results.summary_short: “8: The Mormon Proposition,” about California’s gay marriage battle, is directed by Reed Cowan, who is gay and grew up in a Mormon household.

results.summary_short: Jonah Hill stars in Jay and Mark Duplass’s “Cyrus” as a man-child with serious mommy issues.

results.summary_short: The documentary “45365” looks at the residents of Sidney, Ohio.

results.summary_short: “Stonewall Uprising” examines a police raid on the Stonewall Inn in Greenwich Village that touched off three days of unrest.

results.summary_short: Neil Diamond’s documentary “Reel Injun” considers shifting Hollywood stereotypes of American Indians.

results.headline: Where Life Is Cold, and Kin Are Cruel

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Winter's Bone

results.summary_short: Debra Granik’s tender adaptation of a novel by Daniel Woodrell follows a young woman in the Missouri Ozarks, as she sets out to find her father.

results.headline: In This Remake of an ’80s Martial Arts Fable, It’s Jacket On, Jacket Off

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Karate Kid

results.summary_short: Jaden Smith has the Ralph Macchio role and Jackie Chan the Pat Morita part in this remake of a 1980s classic, transplanted to China.
